alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 10:14PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Boise, southwestern Valley, northeastern Payette, southeastern Gem and southeastern Washington Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1013 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from French Corner to near Emmett. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sweet and Montour around 1020 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains
